page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND KIRKCOWAN
page.content: Kirkcowan is a village of about 200 inhabitants in the North West of our block. Flowing East and South East through{rough grassland}is the River Tarff which flows into the River Bladnoch. Several{beef farms}are situated to the South and East of the area, while nearer the village is a{ {dairy farm}where Fresians are kept for their milk. The{highest point}is Boreland Fell near a disused quarry. Small areas of{coniferous trees}have been planted. The one main road runs near the River Bladnoch South to Wigtown which gives the district its name. Wigtown comes from the Norse word Vic meaning bay. The nearest towns are Newton Stewart to the East and Stranraer to the West.
